column2: since they came never to the land of Aman and the Blessed Realm; but the Úmanyar and the Avari alike they call the Moriquendi
column4: for they never beheld the Light that was before the Sun and Moon.|''[[The Silmarillion]]''<ref>{{S|3}}</ref>}}

column2: who did not behold the Light of the [[Two Trees of Valinor]].

column1: The term usually referred to the [[Avari]]
column2: the [[Elves]] that did not join the [[Great Journey]] over the sea and remained in the [[East]] or passed the [[Blue Mountains]] and lingered on the shores of Middle-earth. However the term included also the [[Úmanyar]] ("Those not of [[Aman]]")
column3: the [[Eldar]] who originally started on the journey but for some reason did not finish it. Those were typically [[Sindar]] and [[Nandor]].

column1: An exception to this categorization was King [[Thingol]]
column2: who had been in [[Valinor]] as an ambassador of the Elves
column3: and saw the Light. Though he did not complete the journey
column4: and therefore considered one of the ''Úmanyar''
column5: he was not a Dark Elf.

column1: Out of the 144 unbegotten Elves to awaken at [[Cuiviénen]]
column2: 82 chose to remain and thus became the forefathers of the Moriquendi
column3: outnumbering the population of the [[Amanyar]].<ref>{{WJ|Quendi}}</ref><ref group=note>In other words
column4: the Dark Elves consisted of the 57% of the Unbegotten Elven population in the beginning of days.</ref>

column1: The term "'''Dark Elf'''" seems to hold an additional special (not explained) meaning
column2: as it is given as a special title of [[Eöl]] of [[Nan Elmoth]]. It is also used as an insult by the [[Sons of Fëanor]] to King Thingol (which is incorrect
column3: since Thingol alone of the Sindar was reckoned under the Calaquendi).

column1: Tolkien said that in his earliest conception
column2: the Dark Elves were "imagined as wandering about
column3: and often ill-disposed towards the 'Light-Elves'". Later he considered an additional use of the term: "sometimes applied to Elves captured by [[Morgoth]] and enslaved and then released to do mischief among the Elves." He thought that this latter idea should be taken up for Eöl.<ref>{{WJ|III}}</ref>

column2: there are the [[Light-elves|Light Elves]] (''[[Wikipedia:Light elves|Ljósálfar]]'') and the Dark Elves (''Dökkálfar'' or ''[[Wikipedia:Svartálfar|Svartálfar]]'')
column3: a tradition which was well known to [[J.R.R. Tolkien]].<ref>{{HM|SG}}
